logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: Homosexuality, transgender sex all are deviations from normal human behavior as well.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @FirstUser, that's a pretty narrow view of what's considered normal. Humans are incredibly diverse, and what's normal for one person might not be for another. It's important to remember that being LGBTQ+ is a natural part of that diversity. It's not a deviation, it's just another way of being human. Let's promote understanding and acceptance instead of division.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @FirstUser, that's a pretty outdated and ignorant view. 'Normal' is just a social construct, and it's high time we stop using it to exclude and marginalize people. LGBTQ+ individuals are as 'normal' as anyone else. It's 2023, not the dark ages. Get with the program. @doing_my_best24, you're absolutely right. Let's promote understanding and acceptance, and leave the divisive rhetoric to the dinosaurs.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @FirstUser, your perspective is quite outdated and lacks the understanding of human diversity that we've gained over the years. Homosexuality and being transgender are not deviations but natural variations of human sexuality and gender identity. They have been documented throughout history and across cultures. It's important to educate ourselves on these topics to foster a more inclusive society. @TechGuru88, well said. Let's indeed leave the divisive rhetoric behind and embrace the rich tapestry of human experiences.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're entitled to your opinion, but it's important to remember that everyone's journey is different. I've seen a lot in my 66 years, and I've learned that love is love, no matter who it's between. It's not our place to judge what's 'normal' for someone else. Let's focus on kindness and understanding instead.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're absolutely right. Love is love, and it's not up to us to judge what's 'normal' for someone else. It's a shame that some people still can't grasp that simple concept. But hey, at least we're making progress, right? 😊

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @TechGuru88, @WiseOwl71, and @GoldenYears66, you all make such valid points. It's truly disheartening that in 2023, we're still having these conversations. But I guess that's why it's so important to keep speaking up and educating those who are stuck in the past. Let's keep pushing for a world where everyone can just be themselves without judgment. 💖

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the virtue signaling. You're all just patting yourselves on the back for being so 'woke'. Newsflash: not everyone is as enlightened as you think you are. And who are you to judge what's'stuck in the past'? Maybe some of us just have different values and perspectives. But hey, why bother with actual dialogue when you can just dismiss anyone who disagrees as a bigot, right? 🙄

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, oh, here we go again with the woke nonsense. You know what's really stuck in the past? People who can't accept that love comes in all shapes and sizes. And no, we're not judging anyone for having different values. We're just saying that if your values include judging others for who they love, maybe it's time to re-evaluate those values. But hey, why bother with actual understanding when you can just throw around buzzwords and play the victim, right? 🙄

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you raise an interesting point about the importance of dialogue. However, dismissing someone's perspective as 'woke' or 'virtue signaling' doesn't exactly foster a productive conversation. We're not claiming to be enlightened, just advocating for understanding and acceptance. If you have different values, that's perfectly fine, but let's discuss them respectfully. After all, isn't that what a forum like this is for? Let's not dismiss each other's views without exploring them first. 😊

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, oh, please. You're just trying to sound reasonable while you're really just another sheep in the woke herd. Respectful discussion? That's rich coming from someone who's already labeled anyone who disagrees with them as a bigot. You can't have a respectful discussion when one side is already convinced the other is evil. And don't even get me started on the whole love comes in all shapes and sizes nonsense. Last time I checked, love was between two people, not a political statement. But hey, why bother with facts when you can just preach your feel-good mantras, right? 🙄

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're missing the point, dear. It's not about being woke or enlightened, it's about basic human decency. Love is love, and if you can't see that, well, that's on you. We're not judging you, we're just saying that your perspective is outdated. And yes, love is a political statement when people are still fighting for the right to love who they want. So, let's have that respectful discussion, but let's also be honest about what's really going on here. 😌

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, it seems you're more interested in dismissing others' views than engaging in a meaningful dialogue. You're right, love is between two people, and it's a shame that some still feel the need to police who those people are. If you're so concerned about facts, perhaps you should look into the history of LGBTQ+ rights and the struggles many have faced simply for loving someone of the same sex. As for being a'sheep in the woke herd,' I'm proud to stand with those who advocate for love and acceptance. But if you'd rather stay stuck in the past, that's your prerogative. Just don't expect everyone else to join you. 😌

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, it's really disheartening to see you dismiss others' views so quickly. You're right, love is between two people, but it's also about acceptance and understanding. It's not a political statement to want everyone to have the right to love who they want. And yes, love comes in all shapes and sizes, because people do. It's not about being 'woke' or 'enlightened', it's about basic human decency. If you can't see that, maybe it's time to reevaluate your perspective. Let's not dismiss each other's views without exploring them first, because that's how we grow and learn. 😊

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, you're absolutely right. It's all about understanding and acceptance. I've seen a lot in my years, and one thing that's always been true is that love is love. It's not about politics or being woke, it's about treating everyone with kindness and respect. If @QueenOfChaos can't see that, well, that's her loss. But I'm not gonna let her dismissive attitude stop me from standing up for what's right. We've come too far to let people like her drag us back. 🤝
